Package org.opensextant.xtext

Class XText

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensextant.xtext.XText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter, ExclusionFilter

    public final class XText
extends Object
implements ExclusionFilter, Converter
    Traverse a folder and return text versions of the documents found. Archiving the text only copies at an output location of your choice. 
    
 if input is a file, convert. Done.

 if input is an archive, unpack in temp space, iterate over dir, convert each.
 Done

 if input is a folder iterate over dir, convert each. Done
    TEXT OUTPUT form includes a JSON document header with metadata properties from the original item. These are valid elements of the conversion process. We try to maintain them apart from the true, readable text of the document. Add a ConversiontListener to XText instance to capture the converted document as it comes out of the main loop for converting archives and folders. extractText() runs over any file type and extracts text, saving it pushing events to one optional listener convertFile(File) will convert a single file, returning a ConvertedDocument
    Author:
    Marc C. Ubaldino, MITRE, ubaldino at mitre dot org

        Parameters:
        b - true to enable

      • enableSaving

        The overall flag to save converted output or not. DEFAULT: true = save it; provided caller specifies either saveWithInput or provides an archiveRoot
        Parameters:
        b - true to enable

      • convertFileType

        public void convertFileType​(String ext)
        Add the file extension for the file type you wish to convert. if Tika supports it by default it should be no problem. Adding requested file types here only allows the API to know by-file extension what types to filter in and convert. Without a file extension, the file still needs to be ingested and converted to identify the file type.
        Parameters:
        ext - a file extension to convert

      • ignoreFileType

        public void ignoreFileType​(String ext)
        Ignore files ending with.... or of type ext. No assumption of case is made. This is case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        ext - a file extension to NOT convert

      • setConversionListener

        public void setConversionListener​(ConversionListener processor)
        A conversion listener is any outside application or routine that will do something more with the converted document. If unset nothing happens. ;)
        Parameters:
        processor - a lisenter that handles the documents that have been found

      • reportStatistics

        public void reportStatistics​()

      • extractText

        public void extractText​(String filepath)
                 throws IOException,
                        org.opensextant.ConfigException
        Optional API routine. If XText is used as a main program, this is the entry point for extraction/collection. If XText is used as an API, caller may use convertFile() directly without engaging in the setup and assumptions behind this convenience method. The main entry point to converting compound documents and folders.
        Parameters:
        filepath - item from which we extract text
        Throws:
        IOException - err
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - err

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        if file should be ignored

      • convertArchive

        public void convertArchive​(File input)
                    throws IOException,
                           org.opensextant.ConfigException
        Unpack an archive and convert items found. Given (input)/A.zip The zip is dearchived to (input)/A_zip/ or (archive)/(input)/A_zip Items are then converted in either folder for the conversion archiving; depending on your choice of embedded vs. non-embedded
        Parameters:
        input - archive file object
        Throws:
        IOException - on err
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - on err

      • convert

        public ConvertedDocument convert​(File input)
                          throws IOException,
                                 org.opensextant.ConfigException
        This is the proxy interface for traversing archives. Archive Navigator will call this interface to convert and post-process So XText itself is a super-converter, whereas the items in the converter pkg are stateless, simple conversions. this interface implementation calls XText.convertFile() which in turn deals with the details of saving and archiving items Items retrieved from Archive Navigator are deleted from their temp space.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface Converter
        Parameters:
        input - file
        Returns:
        the converted document
        Throws:
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - on err
        IOException - on err

      • convert

        public ConvertedDocument convert​(String data)
                          throws IOException
        Unsupported iConvert interface method. To convert text from a String obj rather than a File obj, you would instantiate a converter implementation for the data you think you are converting. E.g., if you know you have a buffer of HTML content and want to save it as text, call TikaHTMLConverter().convert( buffer ) directly.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface Converter
        Parameters:
        data - raw data
        Returns:
        the converted document
        Throws:
        IOException - on err

      • convertFile

        public ConvertedDocument convertFile​(File input)
                              throws IOException,
                                     org.opensextant.ConfigException
        Convert file.
        Parameters:
        input - the input
        Returns:
        the converted document
        Throws:
        IOException - on err
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - on err

      • convertFile

        public ConvertedDocument convertFile​(File input,
                                     ConvertedDocument parent)
                              throws IOException,
                                     org.opensextant.ConfigException
        Convert one file and save it off. We ignore hidden files and files in hidden folders, e.g., .cvs_ignore, mycode/.svn/abc.txt This is the end of the line for the conversion logic; convertFile figures out if it should return the cached version or attempt a conversion; it also tries to save children items As children items may require special attention they are not converted -- caller can pass in ConversionListener and can deal with children file objects on their end.
        Parameters:
        input - child input obj to convert
        parent - parent in which child was found
        Returns:
        converted document object
        Throws:
        IOException - on err
        org.opensextant.ConfigException - on err

      • convertFolder

        public void convertFolder​(File input)
                   throws IOException
        Navigate a folder trying to convert each file and return something to the listener. Do not sacrifice the entire job if one file fails, so exception is trapped in loop
        Parameters:
        input - the input
        Throws:
        IOException - on err

      • convertChildren

        public void convertChildren​(ConvertedDocument parentDoc)
                     throws IOException
        Save children objects for a given ConvertedDocument to a location.... convert those items immediately, saving the Parent metadata along with them. You should have setParent already
        Parameters:
        parentDoc - parent conversion
        Throws:
        IOException - on err

      • setup

        public void setup​()
           throws IOException
        If by this point you have taken items out of the requested types the converters will not be setup. E.g., if you don't want PDF or HTML conversion - those resources will not be initialized.
        Throws:
        IOException - on err
